verses.kjv: Woe to thee that spoilest, and thou wast not spoiled; and dealest treacherously, and they dealt not treacherously with thee! when thou shalt cease to spoil, thou shalt be spoiled; and when thou shalt make an end to deal treacherously, they shall deal treacherously with thee.
verses.ct: How terrible it will be for you, destroyer who has never been destroyed, you traitor who has never been betrayed! When you finish destroying, you will be destroyed. When you stop betraying, you will be betrayed.

verses.kjv: O LORD, be gracious unto us; we have waited for thee: be thou their arm every morning, our salvation also in the time of trouble.
verses.ct: LORD, show us grace — we have put our hope in you. Be our strength every morning, our salvation in times of trouble.

verses.kjv: At the noise of the tumult the people fled; at the lifting up of thyself the nations were scattered.
verses.ct: At the sound of the uproar, nations fled; when you rose up, peoples scattered in every direction.

verses.kjv: And your spoil shall be gathered like the gathering of the caterpiller: as the running to and fro of locusts shall he run upon them.
verses.ct: Your plunder will be gathered up the way caterpillars strip a field — like a swarm of locusts rushing over it.

verses.kjv: The LORD is exalted; for he dwelleth on high: he hath filled Zion with judgment and righteousness.
verses.ct: The LORD is lifted high, for he lives above all. He has filled Zion with justice and righteousness.

verses.kjv: And wisdom and knowledge shall be the stability of thy times, and strength of salvation: the fear of the LORD is his treasure.
verses.ct: Wisdom and knowledge will be the foundation of your era, and salvation will be your strength. Wholehearted dedication to the LORD is his treasure.

verses.kjv: Behold, their valiant ones shall cry without: the ambassadors of peace shall weep bitterly.
verses.ct: Look — their warriors cry out in the streets; the peace envoys weep with bitter tears.

verses.kjv: The highways lie waste, the wayfaring man ceaseth: he hath broken the covenant, he hath despised the cities, he regardeth no man.
verses.ct: The roads are deserted, and no one travels on them anymore. The covenant has been broken, cities are despised, and no one is respected.

verses.kjv: The earth mourneth and languisheth: Lebanon is ashamed and hewn down: Sharon is like a wilderness; and Bashan and Carmel shake off their fruits.
verses.ct: The land mourns and wastes away. Lebanon is disgraced and withering. Sharon has become like a desert, and Bashan and Carmel are losing their leaves.

verses.kjv: Now will I rise, saith the LORD; now will I be exalted; now will I lift up myself.
verses.ct: "Now I will rise up," says the LORD. "Now I will be lifted high. Now I will show my greatness."

verses.kjv: Ye shall conceive chaff, ye shall bring forth stubble: your breath, as fire, shall devour you.
verses.ct: You conceive dried husks and give birth to straw. Your own breath will consume you like fire.

verses.kjv: And the people shall be as the burnings of lime: as thorns cut up shall they be burned in the fire.
verses.ct: Entire peoples will be burned to powder like limestone; they will be set ablaze like cut thornbushes thrown into flames.

verses.kjv: Hear, ye that are far off, what I have done; and, ye that are near, acknowledge my might.
verses.ct: You who are far away, listen to what I have done! You who are nearby, recognize my power!

verses.kjv: The sinners in Zion are afraid; fearfulness hath surprised the hypocrites. Who among us shall dwell with the devouring fire? who among us shall dwell with everlasting burnings?
verses.ct: The sinners in Zion are terrified; panic has gripped the godless. They ask, "Which of us can survive a consuming fire? Which of us can endure flames that never go out?"

verses.kjv: He that walketh righteously, and speaketh uprightly; he that despiseth the gain of oppressions, that shaketh his hands from holding of bribes, that stoppeth his ears from hearing of blood, and shutteth his eyes from seeing evil;
verses.ct: The one who lives with integrity and speaks honestly, who refuses to profit from oppression, who waves away bribes, who refuses to listen to plots of murder, and who shuts his eyes against evil —

verses.kjv: He shall dwell on high: his place of defence shall be the munitions of rocks: bread shall be given him; his waters shall be sure.
verses.ct: that person will live in safety on the heights. A fortress among the rocks will be his refuge. His food will be provided, and his water supply will never fail.

verses.kjv: Thine eyes shall see the king in his beauty: they shall behold the land that is very far off.
verses.ct: Your eyes will see the king in all his splendor. You will gaze on a land that stretches far into the distance.

verses.kjv: Thine heart shall meditate terror. Where is the scribe? where is the receiver? where is he that counted the towers?
verses.ct: Your mind will reflect on the terror that once was: "Where is the official who kept the records? Where is the one who weighed the tribute? Where is the one who counted the towers?"

verses.kjv: Thou shalt not see a fierce people, a people of a deeper speech than thou canst perceive; of a stammering tongue, that thou canst not understand.
verses.ct: You will no longer see those fierce people — that nation whose language was so foreign you couldn't understand it, whose speech was so strange it made no sense to you.

verses.kjv: Look upon Zion, the city of our solemnities: thine eyes shall see Jerusalem a quiet habitation, a tabernacle that shall not be taken down; not one of the stakes thereof shall ever be removed, neither shall any of the cords thereof be broken.
verses.ct: Instead, gaze on Zion, the city of our festivals! Your eyes will see Jerusalem as a peaceful home, a tent that will never be taken down. Not one of its stakes will ever be pulled up, and none of its ropes will ever snap.

verses.kjv: But there the glorious LORD will be unto us a place of broad rivers and streams; wherein shall go no galley with oars, neither shall gallant ship pass thereby.
verses.ct: There the LORD in his glory will be like a place of wide rivers and streams for us — but no warship with oars will sail on them, and no mighty vessel will pass through.

verses.kjv: For the LORD is our judge, the LORD is our lawgiver, the LORD is our king; he will save us.
verses.ct: For the LORD is our judge, the LORD is our lawgiver, the LORD is our king — he will save us.

verses.kjv: Thy tacklings are loosed; they could not well strengthen their mast, they could not spread the sail: then is the prey of a great spoil divided; the lame take the prey.
verses.ct: Your rigging hangs loose; it cannot secure the mast or spread the sail. Then an enormous amount of plunder will be divided up, and even the lame will carry off the spoils.

verses.kjv: And the inhabitant shall not say, I am sick: the people that dwell therein shall be forgiven their iniquity.
verses.ct: No one living there will say, "I am sick." The people who dwell in that place will have their sin forgiven.
